Demand.title: Demand
Demand.description: Represents a demand or request for IT support.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Demand entity.

creationDate.description: Date and time when the demand was created.

demandType.description: The method by which the demand was created, either 'UI' for structured interface or 'text' for free-form text.

rawInput.description: The raw input provided by the user, either the structured data from the UI or the free-form text.

geminiTitle.description: Standardized title generated by the Gemini API.

geminiDescription.description: Standardized technical description generated by the Gemini API.

geminiResolution.description: Standardized resolution generated by the Gemini API.

helpDeskExportStatus.description: Status of the export to the Help Desk system (e.g., 'pending', 'exported', 'failed').

definition.description: Stores user-specific IT support demands. Each demand is uniquely identified within the user's collection. Path-based ownership ensures only the user can access these documents.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user who created the demand.

params.name: demandId
params.description: The unique identifier of the demand.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to store and manage IT support demands, leveraging Gemini API for processing. The core principle is Authorization Independence, achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. All data is private and owned by the user. We can enable list operation for user data (QAPs) using path based ownership. This design uses a single collection `demands` nested under `/users/{userId}`.
